title.narrative: Improvement of arms and ammunition security and accounting in Somalia

description.narrative: This project represents a continuation of activities under grant 16-GR-1048 (above). The goal of this project is to improve the management and security of arms and ammunition in Somalia through enhancing the ability of federal and regional security forces in Somalia, allowing them to boost their legitimacy and effectiveness at prioritized sites, and reducing the risk of diversion of arms and ammunition into the hands of non-state actors, as well as training and stockpile management. In order to achieve this goal, MAG will implement targeted physical infrastructure improvements to 5 high priority security sector armories for enhanced security and maintenance of arms and ammunition in South Central Somalia and Somaliland; Develop the capacity of 189 security sector personnel to safely and securely manage arms and ammunition, and provide the NSSAs the means to train their own personnel in safe and secure weapons management and accounting practices; and conduct a survey of current storage practices in South Central Capitals to define a priority list of securitization activities.
